alert.note: Alert for Carbon (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 20 at 3:43PM EDT until May 20 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL LEHIGH...EASTERN CARBON...MONROE AND NORTHAMPTON COUNTIES... At 342 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Tobyhanna to Gilbert to Neffs, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Easton, Mount Pocono, Bethlehem, Forks, Northampton, East Stroudsburg, Tobyhanna, Wilson, Hellertown, Nazareth, Palmerton, Bangor, Slatington, Pen Argyl, Wind Gap, Bath, Walnutport, Belfast and West Easton. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 56 and 71. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 52 and 55, and between mile markers 65 and 76. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 287 and 314. Interstate 80 in New Jersey near mile marker 3. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 11. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for northwestern New Jersey...and eastern and northeastern Pennsylvania. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
